page.title: 17Wortley-Traffic Problems
page.content: Wortley lies on the road from Halifax to Sheffield. It is a busy, main road and is dangerous because of a narrow double bend by the church. Sometimes big lorries with wide loads get stuck and there are nasty accidents. The lorries are coming from the steelworks. It is very difficult to cross the road because of all the traffic. Soon a by-pass will be built so that the lorries will not have to use the village. Some people object because the road will cross their land. Before there were buses and cars people used to travel by rail. They had to use a path down the fields to the station where they could catch a steam train. About 20 years ago the railway station was closed. Most people now have cars but those who don't have to rely on the bus which passes through the village.
